definition: to impute/to shift the blame onto someone else
(of a woman) to marry/to marry off a daughter/to shift (blame etc)
old variant of 禍|祸[huo4]
disaster/misfortune/calamity
to pass the misfortune on to sb else (idiom); to blame others/to pass the buck

sentences.english: People would be framed for bombings they did not commit; planes would be hijacked.
sentences.chinese: 人们将爆炸事件嫁祸于他们没有犯，飞机将被劫持。

sentences.english: It sounds like you’re just looking for someone to get mad at other than yourself.
sentences.chinese: 听起来更像是你在嫁祸他人“。

sentences.english: Did Jin-tae do it and plant the evidence?
sentences.chinese: 是金泰干的然后嫁祸于他？

sentences.english: It's your fault. How can you shift the blame onto someone else?
sentences.chinese: 这是你自己的错，怎么能嫁祸于人？

sentences.english: He had stolen the report and then tried to frame Rhys with it.
sentences.chinese: 他偷走了报告，还企图嫁祸于里斯。

definition: to frame sb (by planting sth on them)
to lend sb a knife to kill sb/to get sb else to do one's dirty work/to attack using the strength of another (idiom)
to entrap/to set up/to frame (up)/to make false charges against
to conspire to murder/to plot against sb's life
to kill sb to prevent them from divulging a secret/to silence sb
to kill secretly/to stab in the back
to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb
to pass the misfortune on to sb else (idiom); to blame others/to pass the buck
to put poison in sth/to poison
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
to kill/to cause death/to do sb to death
to frame/to bring false charges against
to assassinate/to commit a murder
to incite/to stir up/to instigate
to injure
to cut weeds and eliminate the roots (idiom); to destroy root and branch/to eliminate completely
